title: Share of ethnic minorities in the China 's minority autonomous regions 2018
summary: This is a bar chart representing Province in the x axis and Share of ethnic minorities in the y axis.
Province Tibet has the highest Share of ethnic minorities and Zhejiang has the lowest Share of ethnic minorities.
The difference of Share of ethnic minorities between the highest and lowest Province is 78.24.
min_summary: This bar chart has 21 columns on the x axis representing Province, and Share of ethnic minorities in each Province on the y axis.
The Share of ethnic minorities is appeared to be the highest at Province Tibet and lowest at Province Zhejiang.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Province in the x axis and Share of ethnic minorities in the y axis.
Province Tibet has the highest Share of ethnic minorities and Zhejiang has the lowest Share of ethnic minorities.
The difference of Share of ethnic minorities between the highest and lowest Province is 78.24.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Province in the x axis and Share of ethnic minorities in the y axis.
The Share of ethnic minorities is appeared to be the highest at Province Tibet and lowest at Province Zhejiang.
Second maximum Share of ethnic minorities is found at Province Hunan.
The highest Province Tibet has 78.24 more Share of ethnic minorities than the lowest Province Zhejiang.
Share of ethnic minorities at Province Tibet is 90.05 , second place is Hunan at 83.5, and thirdly is Chongqing at 74.39.
The Province Tibet has 1.7 times more Share of ethnic minorities than average.
